function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of sewage networks and treatment plants can lead to delayed detection of contagious diseases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in accurately estimating the population size contributing to a sewage treatment plant can result in inaccurate calculations of the percentage of infected population.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Comparison of infection rates between communities using wbe monitoring data requires careful calibration and standardization procedures.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient monitoring data for contagious diseases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient testing leading to lack of confidence in the public about the risk of covid-19 transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possibility of repeated resurgence of covid-19 and common seasonal infectious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on preprints without peer review for research and decision-making","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of international coordination in wbe research for covid-19 and other infectious diseases.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of pcr to test for covid-19 may overestimate the incidence or intensity of existing infections due to rna fragments from virus remnants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate surveillance systems may result in delayed detection of emerging clusters of infectious diseases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infection densities revealed by wbe monitoring may uncover community vulnerabilities related to race, ethnicity, socioeconomic status, occupation, age structure, and climate","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contrarian views regarding infectivity and spreading of contagious diseases","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient data on fecal markers for sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fecal-oral transmission route could prove significant.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Prolonged presence of covid-19 rna in feces after respiratory tract tests negative.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global cooperation not comprehensive due to government reluctance or lack of resources","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of centralized clearing house for wbe data and knowledge","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reluctance to publicize wbe data by some governments","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordination and standardization in wbe pilot projects targeting covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mention of drug use may pose a risk of substance abuse and addiction, which can contribute to public health issues and disease transmission.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mention of national coalitions or efforts for covid-19 may indicate areas with active transmission and potential for disease spread.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Geographically fragmented data collection and reporting system","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wbe not used to monitor for viable, infectious virions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Erroneous belief in the presence of \"live\" virus in sewage","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intense interest in the potential release of virus into surface waters","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in u.s. federal agencies’ interest in wbe for covid-19 tracking","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to reduced social distancing measures and increased urban activity.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in adapting existing urban infrastructure to meet the demands of medical activities such as mass vaccination, testing, and treatment.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Debate on the compatibility of compact city model with the concept of pandemic-proof cities.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Widespread experience of covid-19 as a shock to the system","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reemergence of diseases through sudden outbreaks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Environmental factors such as rainfall, temperature, and soil types creating conditions for microbe proliferation.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socio-economic, demographic, and cultural factors contributing to the emergence and spread of disease.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mobility patterns and trade routes facilitating the spread of infectious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deadly disease outbreak in field hospitals and spread along railway and shipping routes.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Persistent belief in miasma theory leading to stigmatization of urban poverty and unsanitary practices, contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity and crowding in urban areas leading to rapid spread of diseases from person to person.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of infrastructure for uncontaminated and treated drinking water leading to outbreaks of waterborne diseases such as cholera, typhoid, hepatitis, and polio.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical evidence of urban strategies of containment and spatial distancing to combat disease since ancient times, prefiguring modern social distancing strategies.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Strategies involving the rejection or exclusion of people from cities or the imposition of controls upon the movements of entire populations as historical ways of exerting power in response to public health threats.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of deadly diseases such as tuberculosis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unhygienic living conditions and dense living spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Obsession with hygiene by design leading to unintended consequences","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between disease outbreaks and urban governance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"City confronted with earlier epidemics","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cholera and yellow fever epidemics in buenos aires between 1867 and 1871","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited understanding of disease leading to development of military cantonments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reshaping of rural landscape creating ideal habitats for disease vectors","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disproportionate impact of pandemic on lower-caste hindu population","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cure or vaccine for tuberculosis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
